lead_paragraph: The head of the agency that manages travel for Kiran Bedi severed ties with her nongovernmental organization,  India Vision Foundation, on Tuesday. Anil Bal, proprietor of Flywell Travel, claimed that the controversy over the inflated travel invoices furnished by Ms. Bedi had unnecessarily tarnished his reputation. Mr. Bal, a founding member of the foundation, also resigned as trustee of the organization (The Indian Express).Prime Minister Manmohan Singh was skeptical of the July 2005  nuclear agreement with the United States in the run-up to the joint statement declaring the pact, a new book by former U.S. Secretary of State Condelezzaa Rice claims. Mr. Singh was wary about the impact of the deal on domestic politics, Ms. Rice writes in her upcoming memoir "In No Higher Honor." The then-foreign minister, Natwar Singh, was far more adamant about the deal -- called  the U.S.-India Civil Nuclear Cooperation -- and worked with U.S. officials to persuade the prime minister it was a good idea (Hindustan Times).

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Wednesday
